values:
I really didn't think this was going to happen anytime soon, but it did: I passed my driving test last Tuesday, so wooo-hooo. About half of the people fail the first time, so it's definitely something to be proud of when you pass the first time, which I did.
The only problem now is that my parents only have got one car... Well I'll have to figure that out later.

HAPPY GRADUATION TO EVERYBODY!
Show me pictures, lots of them!

I really suck at updating here. Maybe it's because I don't seem to be able to form any of my thoughts in English anymore. My German blog is updated daily, so it's not a lack of interest or excitingness in my life...

so long

The Football Club Zurich won the championship last night! They played against Basel and they had to win, because they had 3 points less than Basel. Not even a tigh would've been enough. I watched the game on TV, the tickets for the stadium were sold out. FCZ played very well, they scored after 30 minutes. Then, in the second half, Basel scored the 1:1. In OVERTIME Zurich's best defender scored the winning goal! GOSH, it was SO exciting!

Guess what I ate today?

Ben and Jerry's Ice Cream! YAY! Jerry (Cherry, I mean, hehee) Garcia! It was so yummy. God, how I miss Vermont (not only because of the ice cream tough :))

I am off to Mallorca. Will be back Monday I think.
Good Luck to all the lacrosse girls for tomorrow's game! I hope you'll kick some ass, heheee

Again something from Julie's journal. It sounds quite funny, let's see what will come out.

Put your music player on shuffle. Press forward for each question. Use the song title as the answer to the question. NO CHEATING!

1.) How am I feeling today?
"Somebody loves me" - Frank Sinatra
I love this game <3

2.) Where will I get Married?
"California" - Phantom Plantet
OMG I LOVE this game <3

3.) What is my best friend's theme song?
"Take me out" - Franz Ferdinand

4.) What is/was highschool like?
"Tutti Frutti" - Little Richard

5.) What is the best thing about me?
"The boy from New York City" - Manhattan Transfer
Which one exactly...?? hehee

6.) How is today going to be?
"Movie Star" - Harpo
I doubt it. All I have planned for today is a driving lesson. Let's hope that won't be anything like in a (action)movie...

7.) What is in store for next weekend?
"What a feeling" - Irene Cara
woo-hooo

8.) What song describes my parents?
"Ain't no love" - David Gray
omg, this is sad...

9.) How is my life going?
"The Road to Mandalay" - Robbie Williams

10.) What song will they play at my funeral?
"Thriller" - Michael Jackson 
loool

11.) How does the world see me?
"You're Beautiful" - James Blunt
I swear, I'm not cheating, haha

12.) What do my friends really think of me?
"Georgia on my mind" - Ray Charles

13.) Do people secretly lust after me?
"The sun ain't gonna shine anymore" - The Walker Brothers

14.) How can I make myself happy?
"She's not just a pretty face" - Shania Twain

15.) What should I do with my life?
"Hippy Hippy Shake" - The Swinging Blue Jeans
I LIKE that one

16.) Will I ever have children?
"Out of my Mind" - James Blunt
I guess that means no...

17.) What is some good advice?
"Hey Jude" - The Beatles
What about Jude?

18.) What do I think my current theme song is?
"More than a feeling" - Boston 
Julie's comment on her answer: I have never listened to this song before it started playing today. Freaky.
Same here, I hav never heard that song before. Very freaky...

19.) What does everyone else think my current theme song is?
"Follow through" - Gavin DeGraw

20.) What type of men/women do you like?:
"Lost in France" - Bonnie Tyler
I guess I will go looking for lost men in France.

21.) Will you get married?:
"What a wonderful World" - Joey Ramone

22.) What should I do with my love life?:
"It ain't me Babe" - Joaquin Phoenix&Reese Witherspoon

23.) What's sex like?:
"Summer Nights" - The Grease Cast

24.) Where will you live?
"Curbside Prophet" - Jason Mraz
Anyone out there who can tell me what a curbside prophet is, pleeeeaaaase?

25.) What will your dying words be?
"If it were up to me" - Rooney

haha, i love these questions, thanks Julie.
<font size="1" color="#333333">Don't make me cry again.</font>

5. Been kissed: no :(
6. Ate something: too much actually
7. Felt stupid: not more than usually

1. Layed in your bed: me, myself and I
2. Saw you cry: don't remember

take the month of the day you were born and find what it says

may- i am able
june- i try
july- i want
august- i tend
september- i fail
october- i know how
november- i get
december- i dream

now take the year

1911-1920 to sex
1921-1930 to hump
1931-1940 to play with
1941-1950 to touch
1951-1960 to feel
1961-1970 to grope
1971-1980 to eat
1981-1990 to rape
1991-2000 to molest
2001-2010 to finger

I am doing anything to avoid studying history at the moment... There's a test tomorrow, but it's such a boring topic, blaaaahhhh

Here are two pictures of my volleyball team (if you don't remember what I look like, I'm #7, hehee)



Alright, I couldn't upload the second one, I'll try again tomorrow.

Here's #2:



Love, Patricia

Remember when I told you that spring usually starts earlier in Switzerland than it does in Vermont? Cross that out. Not true. Absolutely not. It has been snowing all day, I cannot believe it. And it's not little, cute snowflakes that melt when they hit the ground. NO! Thy are big, fat, ugly snowflakes that are everywhere now! On our neighbor's roof, there's about 2 inches by now. There'll be more soon than it doesn't look like it's going to stop. Ever. Maybe there will even be snow on my birthday. How great.

Love, Patricia

OMG! It took me about a million hours to upload a new design and some new stuff on my website... There's a little shoutbox now, so drop a line if you have time!

What's new? I finished reading "Catcher in the Rye" by J.D Salinger a few days ago and I loved it! I's so funny to read, even though what's happening is not always funny. I love the way the author writes, you can really hear Holden's voice in your head.

Spring finally came to Switzerland. It has been pretty warm the past few days and the sun has been shining a lot! It's so nice to feel sunlight on your skin, I missed that!

There was a little article in our local newspaper about the Rotten Sneaker Contest in Montpelier. I had to laugh so hard, haha. It was the first time ever I read something about Montpelier in our newspaper and it has to be something like that, loool.

love, patricia

I am totally into making those LJ-Icons <3.
Here are some I made recently:


There's more here: http://colorfulfairytale.piranho.com/
Please visit!

If you use one of the icons, please credit to patricia13887 and do not hotlink!

Love, Patricia

don't know exactly why there is no school monday and tuesday, i think it's because the teachers are going somewhere, not sure... but I love it! it's sunday and i can relax all day without being stressed from a lot of homework.
On friday it was a friend of mine's birthday, she turned 19. we went to a mexican restaurant (the food was yummy) and to a club afterwards (which was sort of lame 'cause there weren't a lot of people).
Yesterday we had a volleyball game which we lost 3:0, lool. but the fc zurich won 1:0 and they might even win the championship this year :)!

love, patricia

i am becoming addicted to lj, hehee.
my schoolday, it's the most exhausting one in my schedule:


7:30-9:10 - double period english: we talked about formal and informal letters and stuff like that. i am so bad at formal writing, just can't do it in english.

9:20-10:05 - biology. we did (made?) a little experiment with the dna of a kiwi, it was quite fun to mash the kiwi and stuff. and at the end you could actually see the dna!

10:20-12:00 - double period french. absolutely boring! we're having an intern at the moment and she is so annoying. she actually wants us to work, can you believe that^^? we're reading "monsieur ibrahim et les fleurs du coran", i've read it before but it's quite good.

01:20-03:00 double period math. awful! the teacher never explains anything and his english is horrible (we're being taught in english in maths, bio and history). he has the hardest swiss accent you could possibly imagine and his grammar is not quite as bad but still horrible. you here things like: "let's give him an A for his work" or "oh, you was here yesterday?" *rolleyes* i am not saying my english is perfect or anything but he, as a qualified teacher should speak english way better than he does.

03:10-03:55 - physics. even though i didntt use to like physics, i quite enjoy it now. the teacher is nice, she is very young.


then i had a driving lesson. it was okay i guess. the only thing is that i CANNOT drive a stick. i just can't. imagine this situation: i am at a red light and it turns green. now it takes me about 10 seconds to accelerate (spelling??) because i am afraid to kill the motor :D. the driving teacher hates me for that, hehee.


love, patricia

THAT'S what it looks like outside, I can't believe it... It was a relatively mild winter with little snow here in zurich (it was quite cold with a lot of snow up in the mountains) but now that it's march, winter gives a comeback! It's horrible! I got home arount 3 am last night and there was at least 1.5 foot snow on the sidewalk... It took me about 20 minutes to walk home from the train station which usually takes about 5-10 minutes. And because people here are not used to a lot of snow, there was a total chaos: the public transport in zurich is not working at all today and trees crashed under the heavy snow... I am hoping for school being cancelled tomorrow, that would be the first time ever! But i don't think it's going to happen. there is one bad thing about the snow: i started taking driving lessons a few weeks ago and i don't feel comfortable driving on snow... love, patricia

(whom i love for still taking a look at my livejournal even though i am a not updading slacker, hehee)

yes, i am doing well. i just had a two week vacation which i spent in flims, a little village in the alps. because the weather sucked i didn't go skiing very often, but i still enjoyed the first week. i got the flu the second week, so no comment about that week.
how are you doing?
have you guys started lacrosse yet?

i'll try to update more, i promise...

with this new desing and new motivation to keep my livejournal alive, i am trying to update at least on a weekly basis. mainly to do something in english, because i feel like i can't speak english very fluently anymore...

starting tomorrow!

ok, i am still alive. just in case anybody was wondering. i am trying to update more here, but i've been quite busy lately. school's tough and besides hanging out with my boyfriend, practising volleyball and doing schoolwork i don't have a lot of time for doing other stuff. plus sleeping. now that winter is coming i need more sleep. 9 hours per night would be perfect, but impossible. so i have to catch up on sleep every weekend.

more soon

love, patricia
finally back, more tomorrow or so...

i am leaving for norwich tomorrow morning, coming back in three weeks with a fine british accent, hehe

love, patricia
James Blunt/ Jason Mraz Gig in Lodnon is sold out and I didn't get a ticket :(

allright, i am sitting here in the computer lab of our school, quiet bored. we have a free period and believe it or not: NO schoolwork to do. usually i do all my homework at school so i can leave my stuff in the locker and i have more free time at home where i can really enjoy it. 
rebecca is sitting at the computer next to me and is printing pictures from her vacation in Egypt and i am extremely jealous.
what else? we just had a german test: interpretation of a poem. it was pretty difficult and i am not sure whether i am gonna pass or not...

love, patricia


leaving for Norwich in 10 days

allright, the chemistry test is postponed for wendesday, thank heaven! but i still don't have an idea how i am gonna do it... at least i have all afternoon tomorrow
PLUS: i am a little physics genious, i've always known it, hehe. i got a 5 which would probably be a B in the US. thinking of the fact that i failed the last two semesters of physics thats a terrific grade :D!!!
gotta study some chemistry and do my german homework. and bio. and italian. and french. and pretty much all the other classes.

love, patricia

blah... there is a chemistry test tomorrow and i don't want to study for it... plus i have to write a report for english which shouldn't be too hard, but its time-consuming, plus there is a ton of physics homework which i don't get at all...

BUT: only two more weeks until we're going to england!! i recieved the letter from the school yesterday telling me who is going to be my hostfaily. it's a retired couple with grown up children and grand children. they live in a pretty big house in the residential area of the city. i am taking the bus to school, it's gonna take about 15 minutes. yeah, that's all i know so far. i just emailed them so maybe they are telling me a little bit more soon.

love, patricia

Which Gilmore Character Are You? by debra_ashby
First Name
Character
Quiz created with MemeGen!
yes, I have been pretty bored the last couple of days, that's one of the reasons why i am taking all tese funny little quizzes, hehe. i had my physics test on monday and since then there hasn't been ANY hoework... hard to believe, i know. but then i have nothing to do at home. volleyball starts next week but until then all i do is reading, instant messaging and watching tv at home, lol. BUT: from time to time i went for a really quick run, only 2k, but it's pretty nice. today school is cancelled because all the 12th graders (here i am only a 11th grader...) are taking the pre-matura (huge test at the end of the swiss grammar schools) in geography and biology. so they somehow don't have enough classrooms, good for all the other students. but i still have to go to my singing class, and i actually gotta go now. maybe i am updating later a little bit more, i am feeling like writing today. love, patricia ps. i miss you guys!!!! :(

loool

wow... i just realized that i haven't updated in quite a while...! it's mainly because i have been very busy at school. yes... school started last monday, i was quite excited, actually. i got to meet all new people that was cool. they were all very, very nice. but there are bad parts too: we are having a physics test tomorrow... HELP!!! i doubt that i have that part of brain which is there for physical thinkin. i just don't get it. well, whatever, i already studies about 4 hours and i am planning on doing some more work after the soccer game this afternoon.
gotta do homework now

love, patricia
btw, do you like my new userpic? i made it myself and it's THE best soccer player ever for those who didn't know that already, lool

i am going to berne on sunday for a soccer game
the game is some sort of a date ;)
but the guy has a girlfriend at the moment =(
but he told me he is going to break up with her soon =)
whatever, i will see what is going to happen

only two more days at the peeeeeep factory (don't ever mention the ch*******-word again!!!!

i am really tired and going to bed really soon

i love james blunt's music, especially "goodbye lover", "billy", "so long jimmy" and "you're beautiful"

tomorrow i am buying ch******* to send to vermont

this was a really random entry

love, patricia

didn't get the coldplay tickets, too bad...
but: i found even better music: james blunt's first album called "back to bedlam" is amazing!!! reminds me a little bit of coldplay.

btw, fcz lost the game aginst basel... 2:1... but it's not that bad, they're gonna win the next one (i hope!!)

i have my own graphics site, but right now it's still under construction. visit http://colorfulfairytale.piranho.com/.

is anybody of you watching veronica mars?? i just downloaded the first 4 episodes and i love it (see new picture, haha)!!

thats it, no more for the moment

love, patricia

hum... i just signed up for a casting for a new radio station in zurich. they are looking for people. it would be my dream to work for a radio station. the casting is 8/16 and 8/17, wish me luck!!!!!

love, patricia

so, bad news... i'm not going to the game on saturday because my friend didn't get the car. he's sooooo stupid, blah. now i have to sit at home saturday night because everybody else already has a date because they thought i was going to the game (*cry*)!!! whatever, i can have fun all by myself. yes i do!!! *sniff*

ok, really funny thing happened yesterday. i went to the pool with a friend of mine. she wanted to swim 1km which would be 40 lanes if the pool was 25 meters long (i know, i'm really good at math, heh, heh). so we swam (is that the past form for to swim?? no idea...!!) for about 45 minutes and when we were done we both were like: wow, it took us really long...! so we asked someone how long the pool was, and it was 50!!!! meters, so we swam (still no clue) 2k instead of one!!! it was so funny! and today i'm really sore, lol!

love, patricia

ps, is andybody still reading my lj or can i give it up??

hum... anybody know where the lazenbys are? they're not picking upt the phone, and i need to ask them some pretty important questions... are they on vacation?

life here ist stressful. i am sick of chocolate and i still have 3 1/2 weeks of work ahead of me...! but at least i have this monday off (the swiss 4th of july, haha), so i can relax a bit.
maybe i'm going to basel this saturday for a soccer game, but it all depends whether a friend of mine is getting his parents' car or not. i really hope he is. 

what else...? is anything happening in vermont? are you guys going on vacation?

love, patricia

it was AMAZING!!! my team won 4:2, it was great, i still can't believe it!!!! and there were 18700 people, thats twice as much as for a regular game!!
nothing more to say, next weekend they're playing last year's champion away and I AM GOING!!!
off to the soccer game, I'm so excited!!!!!!!!!

so, i finished the hp book, too. took me only a week, regarding the fact that i worked 9 1/2 hours every day it's pretty good. i was a little disappionted of snape...! i toght he was good, he was my favorite!!! but now...! and i can't wait to see voldemort in the movie, if he is as handsome as described in the book he must be the man of my dreams, haha.
i forgot to tell that i am house sitting my aunt's house from monday on for two weeks. well, i am more plant and cat sitting, i am not living there while they're gone. i just water the plants and feed the cat. but it's great. i get a lot of money for basically not doing anything, haha. and they have a great house with a huge balcony and stuff. so i can spend my evenings there lying in the sun, i love it!

alright (do you spell alright with one l or two???), it's time to update my lifejournal. i am so busy working at the chocolate factory that i hardly ever have time to be online...! and when i am i forget about my lifejournal, haha.
so... tomorrow is the first soccer homegame, i am so excited! they won their first game which was away 3:1, so i am really optimistic. they play the other team from zurich, so a lot of people are expected and it's gonna be awesome!!
yesterday i was at a freind's house, she quit school here and is moving to the us (her mum is american) and finishing high school there. we were all shocked when we heard it because she's never coming back agian, it's so sad!!
what else...? hm, can't think of anything... oh, yeah: i'm almost done with the harry potter book!! 100 more pages to go! but i already read the end, so i know all the details, haha!

love, patricia

I love my life. It's awesome right now. The reasons:

- great weather: cloudy and around 70 degrees, i am in love with it. and for the weekend it should get sunny and around 85 degrees. perfect
- i'm in love with my hair. yesterday i bought a styling product by fructis which is called "shake effect gum" (i already love the name), and it's specially for styling surfer hair. it's great, i look like a surfer girl, haha.
- ENGLAND! from 9/18 until 10/9 i am in england with my class! it's gonna be so awesome, I can't wait to get there!!
- Only two more weeks until soccer season starts.
- my friends. they are so lovely! i love spending time with them!
- good music (i love itunes)

love, patricia

wooo-hooo, yesterday i got a letter from the school which said that i got into that (special, haha) class where they teach history, bio, physics and math in english!! which is already great, but the best thing is that i can go to england for 4 weeks right after summer vacation! isnt that great? i can get rid of the horrible american accent and learn beautiful british english (just kiddin')

i am NEVER EVER complaining again about cold weather, i swear!! today is the first day in like forever when the temperature is nice (its around 70 i think and i love it! i can wear shorts and a sweatshirt and i am NOT sweating, its great. 

today one of my friends is coming back from france, she spent the year there. i am seeing her tomorrow, i think.

so long
patricia

bad day... boring and useless. hot and humid. 

ok, yesterday my mother's cousin came to fix the computer and now it should work (let's ignore the "should"). that's a good thing. 
but then this morning was bad. really bad. at around 8:30 (during vacation for me in the middle of the night) they started working on the street. great. the made a new pavement which is the most annoying noise you could imagine at 8:30 in the morning. 
then the mail came. great. a letter from the chocolate factory which is actually a good thing. but then i read it. and it was bad. from 7/4 until 8/19 I work monday through friday from 7 am (!!!!!!!!) until 4:30 pm. and i only have 30 minutes lunch break. i think they want to kill me. i am gonna die. great. at least i earn enough money to buy a laptop AND an iPod, woooooooo-hooooo!!!
then the rest of the day was unbelievably boring. it was way too hot to go outside and i didnt find a date for the lake and i am too pathetic to go by myself, haha. so i spent all day inside sitting on my bed and staring at the wall (ok, thats a lie, but it would have been cool). i downloaded a ton of songs and arranged them very neatly into folders. and i made about 4 new hemp bracelets, thats cool. 

going to bed now, otherwise i die of boringness (if thats possible)

@julie: pudding is great, my father loves the white chocolate one!!

love, patricia

Hm, I'm sorry for not updating as much as I actually want to...! but my PC is semi-broken and it's just really annoying because it freezes all the time. A little summary of the last few days:

I arrived at Zurich airport Monday morning 8 am. I was tired, really tired. I didn't sleep at all in the plane because it was so uncomfortable. And there were some good movies on, haha. My parents and sis were there but also a few friends: Celina, Manuela, Anita, Nadja and Julia (I just tell you the names because in the future I will probably tell more about them). Yup, we all said hello, chatted for a while and then me and my family left. We went to my grandparents'. They, too, were really excited and stuff. It was cool to see them again, I am pretty close to them. After that we went home and I spent the rest of the day unpacking and around seven I crashed and fell asleep. I slept for 16 hours straight!

Tuesday was relaxing day. All I did was buying groceries with my mom, the rest of the day I spent watching TV and stuff.

On Wednesday morning I went to school. That meant getting up at 6:15 in order to catch the train at 6:46. That was rough. But it was worth it. It was really cool to see the school and my classmates again. A lot of them didn't recognize me at first because of my haircut, but after a few seconds they knew who I was, haha. The math teacher who doesn't even recognize students after summer break didn't realize who I was so they told him I was an exchange student from the US. And he believed them! It was so funny. When all the others started solving problems he came up to me and said: Sprechen sie deutsch (do you speak German?)? and I started laughing and told him my name and it took him about 10 seconds to realize who I was, it was so funny. Then in physics the teacher didn't even realize that I was there, that was funny, too. And English was the highlight anyway. The teacher talks sort of British English and I just started talking in the (cool) American way. She didn't really like that, but whatever, haha. She made me tell the class everything about beautiful Vermont and about school in the US, I talked for about 10 minutes, haha.

Thursday was another relaxing day, don't really remember what i did... probably sleeping and watching TV.

And Friday I went to school one more time to go to the main office and arrange some things for my next school year and stuff. And at night i met with Raquel, Karin, Sandra, Isabel and Miriam. We went for dinner and in a bar afterwards (woooo-hoooo, that's what I missed most). we had lots of fun talking. I told them about my year and they told me all the school gossip I missed. It was fun.

And today I slept until 11:30, which was very nice. Later I am going to celina's house, we are watching a soccer game on TV and after that we are going downtown. I'm not sure yet what were doing exactly.

 

I totally forgot maayan in the last entry (if you read my lj, maayan, I'm sorry). Here it is: you totally have to come and visit me someday so we can watch a soccer game together. And if they are loosing the game we can tell the coach that we have an American soccer star in the stadium and she should get a chance to play!!
